basics.name: Timothy Huo
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. and M.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate with my B.S. in Spring 2023.

skills.name: Languages and Frameworks
keywords: AWS, Bootstrap, HTML/CSS, Java, Javascript (ReactJS), Meteor, Python, Semantic UI

highlights: Built RESTful APIs using AWS Lambda and API Gateway to create a stable and scalable hoteling platform for 200+ employees to establish communication with users, databases, and other AWS tools
Designed and developed recurring reservation features to reduce load time using Python and PostgreSQL
Created automated tests to monitor and debug API endpoints using Postman and pytest
Led daily scrum meetings and sprint retrospectives with a development team of 7
Maintained a production-level software system using ReactJS, Typescript, and MongoDB
Implemented web scrapers to collect 1000+ internships from sites using Puppeteer.js
Presented RadGrad2 summer research project and pilot study at the 2021 SURE Symposium

volunteer.summary: A 501(c)3 non-profit leveraging the power of our youth to promote technology education, mentorship, collaboration and service across Hawaii.
highlights: Spearhead and manage a high school after school pilot program (20+ students) teaching foundations of software engineering including web development, project management, and hosting
Develop and maintain the organization’s websites and digital security with a development team of 5 using HTML, CSS, Javascript, Bootstrap, Jekyll, Sass, and GitHub
Analyze participants’ demographics and statistics to visualize trends using Python libraries
Participate in technology workshops and live coding sessions teaching 6-12 grade students

volunteer.summary: A Registered Independent Organization (RIO) at the University of Hawaii that offer college student-lead coding programs to youth.
highlights: Mentor 6-12 grade students in 3-month courses about the fundamentals of web development
Oversee activities relating to mentor-in-training sessions, recruitment (reached a max capacity of ~30/40 6-12th grade students yearly), and in-person/remote course preparation

volunteer.summary: A leadership program providing free courses and workshops for a select group of incoming freshmen at the University of Hawaii at Manoa.
highlights: Planned engaging workshops that explores academics/careers and develop skills for the freshman cohort
Designed promotional items and advertising materials for events and marketing purposes

awards.title: 3rd Place and Peoples' Choice Hawaii Annual Code Challenge
awards.summary: Interactive, accessible online application that encourages people to learn more about the internet and technology

awards.title: 1st Place Hawaii Annual Code Challenge
awards.summary: Online reporting platform that helps Hawai’i Marine Animal Response organize sighting reports from the public

awards.title: 1st Place Meteor Hackathon
awards.summary: Community application to help organize events (e.g., cleanups and workshops) and communicate through forums
